Add a quick tooltip text column to data.

Source: R/mutate_text.R
mutate_text.Rd

Add a column of tooltip text which is automatically created based on column names and values.

mutate_text(data, text_vars_vctr = NULL)

Arguments

data

A tibble or dataframe. Required input.
text_vars_vctr

A vector of quoted variables to include in the tooltip. Defaults to NULL, which adds all variables in.

Value

A tibble or data frame with an additional column called text.

Examples

library(dplyr)

plot_data <- slice_sample(ggplot2::diamonds, prop = 0.05) %>%
  mutate_text(c("carat", "price"))

plot_data
#> # A tibble: 2,697 × 11
#>    carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z text       
#>    <dbl> <ord>     <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      
#>  1  0.25 Good      H     VVS1     60.6    64   401  4.05  4.07  2.46 Carat: 0.2…
#>  2  1.01 Very Good F     SI1      63.1    59  5010  6.3   6.37  4    Carat: 1.0…
#>  3  1.12 Ideal     G     VVS2     61.9    57  9214  6.62  6.66  4.11 Carat: 1.1…
#>  4  1.11 Premium   G     VS2      61      59  5346  6.7   6.67  4.08 Carat: 1.1…
#>  5  0.92 Premium   H     SI1      62      60  3555  6.27  6.21  3.87 Carat: 0.9…
#>  6  0.55 Very Good D     SI1      63.1    56  1593  5.19  5.22  3.28 Carat: 0.5…
#>  7  1.06 Ideal     F     SI2      61.8    56  5354  6.56  6.51  4.04 Carat: 1.0…
#>  8  0.7  Very Good I     VS1      63.3    55  1995  5.64  5.6   3.56 Carat: 0.7…
#>  9  0.41 Ideal     H     SI1      62.4    56   876  4.78  4.74  2.97 Carat: 0.4…
#> 10  0.59 Very Good E     SI1      62.9    58  1652  5.31  5.34  3.35 Carat: 0.5…
#> # … with 2,687 more rows

plot <- gg_point(data = plot_data,
                 x_var = carat,
                 y_var = price,
                 text_var = text,
                 title = "Diamond price by carat",
                 x_title = "Carat",
                 y_title = "Price ($US thousands)")
#> Warning: Ignoring unknown aesthetics: text

plotly::ggplotly(plot, tooltip = "text")
